instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.PP1V8_S3: What is PP1V8_S3? The PP1V8_S3 signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides a voltage of 1.8 volts during the S3 power state. The S3 state, often referred to as "suspend to RAM," is a low-power mode where the computer saves the session's state to RAM, allowing for quicker wake-up times compared to a full shutdown..
definitions.PP1V05_SUS: What is PP1V05_SUS? The PP1V05_SUS signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that supplies 1.05 volts, typically used in a suspended (SUS) state of the laptop. This state is a low-power mode where essential system functions are maintained, but the majority of the system is powered down..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_LRESET_L: What is SMC_LRESET_L? SMC_LRESET_L is a typo of SMC_RESET_L. .

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B-A No enciende consumo 844ma
threads.message:
me trajeron esta macbook que no enciende, primer intento de encender sube a 500ma y baja a 25ma, segundo intento llega hasta los 850ma y se mantiene, no aumenta y no baja el consumo, el equipo no presenta sonido ni imagen, tampoco da imagen por adaptador a hdmi y vga.

Medi las siguientes lineas:

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 8.56V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 8.56V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 8.56V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> = 16.69V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> = 16.69V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.43V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.34V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> = 3.34V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> = 3.34V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> = 3.33V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4SW_SNS</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_SSD</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_TBTAPWR</SIGNAL> = 3.34V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S3</SIGNAL> = 1.78V
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> = 1.2V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_SUS</SIGNAL> = 1.0V
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> = 1.5V

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B-A No enciende consumo 844ma
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL> = 1.03v
intente medir esta linea  <SIGNAL>CPU_VR_READY</SIGNAL>   pero al tocar la resistencia para medir, se apaga la board

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B-A No enciende consumo 844ma
threads.message:
Aparece la tension CPU core (L7310/20)?
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> sube de nivel?
Si no, revisa tension en los pines 3 & 7 de <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>.

Algun historial de averia?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B-A No enciende consumo 844ma
threads.message:
L7310/20 tienen un voltaje de 1.7v
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  = 3.3v
ambos pines 3 y 7 de <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> tienen 3.4v

este macbook ya se habia reparado antes en otro servicio tecnico, fue manipulado y tiene marcas de plumon

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B-A No enciende consumo 844ma
threads.message:
el consumo es de 0.969A en la fuente

medi <SIGNAL>SMC_LRESET_L</SIGNAL> = 0.93V

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B-A No enciende consumo 844ma
threads.message: Todas las se√±ales de reset drevidas de la salida de <CHIP>U2071</CHIP>, deben estar en nivel alto; soluciona ese problema!

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B-A No enciende consumo 844ma
threads.message: aparentemente el problema es la resistencia <RESISTOR>R2089</RESISTOR> de la linea <SIGNAL>CAM_PCIE_RESET_L</SIGNAL> que al conectarla de 3v se hacen .9v va al <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B-A No enciende consumo 844ma
threads.message:
Parece que tienes un problema con <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>.
Arranca la maquina si quitas <RESISTOR>R2089</RESISTOR>?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B-A No enciende consumo 844ma
threads.message: <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> ese era el problema, lo reemplace y funciono, solo que mi bateria se descargaba muy rapido en 7% llegaba a 2% en 30seg , la cargue al 100 y parece estar bien.
